data.title: Troup County, GA
data.meta_description: Troup county, GA local info. Troup county has 68,375 residents in 2010-2014, ranked #34 in Georgia. Also Troup county races, income, school, weather, environment and other info / rankings.
data.text:
Troup County

Troup county is located in west Georgia. Troup county has 413.99 square miles of land area and 31.97 square miles of water area. As of 2010-2014, the total Troup county population is 68,375, which has grown 16.33% since 2000. The population growth rate is lower than the state average rate of 21.03% and is higher than the national average rate of 11.61%. Troup county median household income is $41,906 in 2010-2014 and has grown by 18.15% since 2000. The income growth rate is higher than the state average rate of 16.28% and is much lower than the national average rate of 27.36%. Troup county median house value is $118,300 in 2010-2014 and has grown by 41.34% since 2000. The house value growth rate is higher than the state average rate of 33.09% and is lower than the national average rate of 46.91%. As a reference, the national Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation rate for the same period is 26.63%. On average, the public school district that covers Troup county is better than the state average in quality. The Troup county area code is 706.
